com.mellanox.jxio

Class MsgPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mellanox.jxio.MsgPool

  • public class MsgPool
extends java.lang.Object
    Both client and server use MsgPool (different instance of the same object). Server side must bind the pool to EventQueueHandler. Each Msg in MsgPool will be zero copied via the RDMA transport to the remote peer.

    InSize and outSize for client and server need to be reversed. For example:

    Client: MsgPool p1 = new MsgPool(10, 8192, 64)

    Server: MsgPool p2 = new MsgPool(10, 64, 8192)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MsgPool

        public MsgPool(int capacity,
       int inSize,
       int outSize)
        Constructor of MsgPool. Creates MsgPool (including allocating and RDMA registering the memory in C).
        Parameters:
        capacity - - number of msg that this pool will contain
        inSize - - size (in bytes) of the receive buffer. For client this will be the response from the server and for the server this will be the request from the client
        outSize - - size (in bytes) of the send buffer. For client this will be the request to the server and for the server this will be the response to the client.

        number of Msgs in MsgPool

      • getMsg

        public Msg getMsg()
        Returns a Msg from the pool (or null if pool is empty). This method should be called on client side.
        Returns:
        Msg from the pool (or null if pool is empty).

      • releaseMsg

        public void releaseMsg(Msg msg)
        Returns msg back to pool. This method should be called on client side, once the application finished handling the msg
        Parameters:
        msg - to be returned back to pool

      • getId

        public long getId()
        Returns id of the object. The id is unique and represents pointer to the corresponding C object.
        Returns:
        id of the object

      • deleteMsgPool

        public void deleteMsgPool()
        Deletes this MsgPool. This method releases all memory allocated in C and therefore this should be the last method called for this MsgPool
